title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: Pray, anatomize your own mind,and tell me how many grains of your satisfaction is owing to malice, andhow many ounces to friendship. I leave the rest of this paper to befilled up by Edmonstone. I am, &c.

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: "P.S.--After keeping this by me eight days, I have never been able tomeet with Edmonstone. I must, therefore, send off my own part of aletter which we projected in common.

title: Memoirs, journal, and correspondence of Thomas Moore.
author: Moore, Thomas
snippet: Auo-ust 11th. Dined at Locke's: Edmonstone and his brother, Phipps, &c. Edmonstone far more agreeable than usual ; repeated some scmwsmg jeux d" esprit of Mansell's (the Master of Trinity). * * * * Anecdote of the rival shoemakers ; one of them putting up over his shop Mens conscid recti, and the other instantly mounting " Men's and women's conscia recti."

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: The General and Sir Henryare in town, who remember you. Edmonstone is well, and I just now lefthim a-bed. I may perhaps be in London for good and all in a year or two.

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: The General and Sir Henryare in town, who remember you. Edmonstone is well, and I just now lefthim a-bed. I may perhaps be in London for good and all in a year or two.

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: "Our friend Aber is again to enjoy the privilege of franking after a_hiatus valde deflendus_. Edmonstone is at Peterhead drinking the watersfor his health. Sir Harry lives among his boroughs, but not so assiduousin his civilities as formerly; an instance of ingratitude which onewould not expect in a man of such nice honour.

title: House of Achendaroch. An old maid's story
author: Cameron, Mary Emily.
snippet: WUlie Edmonstone, Sandie, Avith Kenneth and AlickMacRae, had been taking a somewhat different route ; now,however, they made one party, and they all set steadily- towork at their shooting. Colin began by bringing down asplendid black-cock, which reminded him of the one he gaveBlanche the tail of, the year before, so he said : " I think,Edmonstone, we seem likely to be lucky; we shall make agood bag after alL"

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: "Edmonstone left this town for Ireland. I wish he were out of the way:he has no prospect of advancement suitable to his merit.

title: Life and Correspondence of David Hume, Volume I (of 2)
author: Burton, John Hill
snippet: "Edmonstone left this town for Ireland. I wish he were out of the way:he has no prospect of advancement suitable to his merit.

title: Heads and tales, or, Anecdotes and stories of quadrupeds and other beasts chiefly connected with incidents in the histories of more or less distinguished men /
snippet: The minister remarked to a friend, " Nae doubt there 's a hantle o' miscellaneous eating aboot a pig." The author of " A Ramble," published by Edmonstone and Douglas in 1865, has devoted some most amusing pages of his work to an account of " Pig-sticking in Chicago," as witnessed  by him during the late American war. The wholesale  and scientific off-hand way in which living pigs enter into one part of a machine, and come out prepared pork, could only have been devised by a Yankee.
